notes: Defusal: The police defused a bomb planted by two men in Isulan, Sultan Kudarat on 1 March 2016. The perpetrators were later captured by the police, though it is not known whether they are affiliated with any armed groups operating in the region.
An influential Saudi Arabian preacher and scholar was shot and wounded when an unidentified assailant shot at him in Zamboanga City on 1 March 2016. The police killed the assailant.
New People's Army (NPA) clashed with the Army's 86th Infantry Battalion of the 5th Infantry Division in Barangay Tappa area, San Mariano, Isabela on 1 March 2016. Three soldiers were wounded.

Protesters gathered at the municipal hall in Candelaria town area, Zambales on 1 March 2016 in protest against nickel ore mining in the region. The police dispersed the crowd and arrested eleven persons.

The Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) (led by Abu Zaiden) clashed with the Army in Barangay Tee area, Datu Salibo, Maguindanao on 1 March 2016. A soldier was killed while two other soldiers were wounded as an improvised bomb exploded during the clash.
A barangay chief was shot dead by two men in Mataas Na Kahoy town, Batangas on 2 March 2016. One of the assailants was shot dead by the village chief who retaliated with fire upon being attacked.
A drug suspect was killed while five other suspects were arrested during a police raid at San Miguel, Bulacan on 2 March 2016.

Four soldiers of the 2nd Mechanized Infantry Battalion were injured in an explosion in Barangay Tee, Datu Salibo, Maguindanao on 2 March 2016. The bomb is thought to have been planted by the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF).
The chief of police of Maragusan, Compostela Valley was shot dead in Tagum City, Davao del Norte on 2 March 2016 by two unidentified assailants.

A transmission tower no. 63 was bombed in Barangay Pagangan, Aleosan, North Cotabato on 2 March 2016. The perpetrators are unknown. This is the second attempt to topple the tower since the beginning of 2016.

Weapons seizure: Troops from the Joint Task Group Sulu (32nd Infantry Battalion) recovered an improvised explosive device from the Abu Sayyaf group and arrested two Abu Sayyaf members during operations in Barangay Kanague, Patikul, Sulu on 2 March 2016.
Environmentalist and indigenous peoples' groups staged a protest against the Mining Act of 1995 in Davao City on 3 March 2016.
Environmentalist and indigenous peoples' groups staged a protest against the Mining Act of 1995 in mining-affected communities across Ilocos Sur province on 3 March 2016.
Environmentalist and indigenous peoples' groups staged a protest against the Mining Act of 1995 in mining-affected communities across Cagayan province on 3 March 2016.

Environmentalist and indigenous peoples' groups staged a protest against the Mining Act of 1995 at the doorstep of the mining company DM Consunji Inc. (DMCI) in Makati City, Metro Manila on 3 March 2016.
Environmentalist and indigenous peoples' groups staged a protest against the Mining Act of 1995 in mining-affected communities across Zambales province on 3 March 2016.

An improvised bomb exploded in Barangay Bagan, Guindulungan, Maguindanao on 4 March 2016, leaving two policemen wounded. The police suspects the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) from staging the bombing.

Property destruction: Armed men burned four passenger buses in Barangay Sta. Arcadia, Cabanatuan City, Nueva Ecija on 4 March 2016. The police is investigating whether the New People's Army (NPA) could have been behind the attack.
Employees of TV5 and other supporters staged a protest on 4 March 2016 outside the TV5 Media Center in Reliance, Mandaluyong, Metro Manila demanding wage increases. [size=no report]

Four soldiers of the Army's 61st Division Reconnaissance Company were wounded on 5 March 2016 when an improvised bomb exploded in Barangay Tee, Datu Salibo, Maguindanao. The bomb had been planted by the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighter (BIFF).

Five soldiers from the 46th Infantry Battalion were wounded after the New People's Army (NPA) detonated an improvised explosive device (IED) in Sitios Logdeck and Candinuyan, Barangay Golden Valley area, Mabini, Davao de Oro on 5 March 2016.

A New People's Army (NPA) member was killed while a soldier was wounded as troopers from the combined 60th and 72nd Infantry Battalions clashed with the NPA in Sitio Agsam, Barangay Ampunan (Datu Ampunan), Laak, Davao de Oro on 5 March 2016.

The Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) attacked the Army's 22nd Mechanized Company detachment in Barangay Magaslong, Datu Piang, Maguindanao on 8 March 2016. Two soldiers and four BIFF members were wounded.
The Army's 61st Infantry Battalion exchanged fire with an unnamed armed group in Sitio Lambasan, Barangay Trangka, Iloilo on 9 March. The Army arrested one of the assailants and seized firearms.

Troops from the 36th Infantry Battalion and 2nd Special Forces opened fire on a Manobo tribe farmer in Barangay Carromata, San Miguel, Surigao del Sur on 11 March 2016 during the Army's anti-insurgency operations against armed groups in the region. The farmer was wounded in the incident. The allegations were reported by the human rights group Karapatan.
Soldiers of the 2nd Special Forces shot and wounded a Manobo farmer on 11 March 2016 in San Miguel, Surigao del Sur.
Displacement: at least 33 Lumad families evacuated from Barangay Carromata, San Miguel, Surigao del Sur as a result of the military shooting and wounding a farmer in the area two days earlier.
Defusal: Two suspected bombers carrying improvised explosive devices were arrested by the police at Sangil Port, Zamboanga City on 13 March 2016. Identity of the suspects was not confirmed.
The leader of a kidnap gang affiliated with the Moro Islamic Liberation Front (MILF) was shot dead after resisting arrest by soldiers and policemen in Naga, Zamboanga Sibugay area on 13 March 2016.

actor2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2010-2016) Philippine Marine Corps
notes: A team of Marines clashed with the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF)in Barangay Tee, Datu Salibo, Maguindanao on 14 March 2016. A soldier was killed while another one was wounded. Casualties on the BIFF side were initially reported although unconfirmed.
Hundreds of fisherfolk protested on 14 March 2016 at the Department of Public Works and Highways (DPWH) in Manila, Metro Manila against a dike project and destruction of Laguna lake.

Gunmen -assumed to be affiliated with a rival candidate from the Liberal Party - killed the father of a Nacionalista Party member who is running for a mayoral post. Two of his companions were also wounded in an ambush in Tungawan, Zamboanga del Sur on 14 March 2016. The motive for the shooting was not confirmed. The NP member himself had been wounded in an ambush in October 2015 during which the late Mayor of the town was killed.

Members of the Joint Task Group Sulu (military and police) were ambushed by suspected Abu Sayyaf group (led by Morasil Mudjahirind) in Barangay Igasan, Patikul, Sulu on 15 March 2016. Two military intelligence members were killed.
A bomb planted by the New People's Army (NPA) exploded along the highway in Purok 5, Barangay Tabuc, Mobo town, Masbate on 15 March 2016.
The New People's Army (NPA) attacked a detachment of the Army's 22nd Infantry and the 3rd CAA Coy in Sitio Anapog, Barangay Poblacion, Claveria area town on 15 March 2016.
A bomb suspected to have been planted by the New People's Army exploded in Barangay Buenasuerte, Uson town, Masbate on 15 March 2016.
The brother of Carcar City councillor was shot dead in his house in Tangasan, Barangay Valladolid, Carcar City on 15 March 2016.
A bomb suspected to have been planted by the New People's Army (NPA) exploded in Barangay Crossing, Uson town, Masbate on 15 March 2016, damaging a Globe Telecom cell site.
A bomb suspected to have been planted by the New People's Army exploded in Barangay Ilaya, Balud town, Masbate on 15 March 2016.
A bomb suspected to have been planted by New People's Army exploded in Barangay Daplian, San Fernando, Masbate on 15 March 2016.
Arrests: A senior New People's Army (NPA) leader was captured and arrested by the Army in Calinan district, Davao City in the month of March 2016.

An improvised explosive device (IED) planted by the New People's Army (NPA) detonated along the road in Barangay Burgos, Batuan, Masbate on 15 March 2016. Two police members were wounded in the attack.
An improvised explosive device planted by the New People's Army (NPA) exploded along the highway in Barangay Tunga, Esperanza town, Masbate on 15 March 2016. No-one was injured in the attack.
A bomb suspected to have been planted by New People's Army exploded at Loving Forest Memorial Garden in Barangay Malinta, Masbate on 15 March 2016.

An election watchdog and other supporters staged a protest over the Commission on Elections' (Comelec) refusal to print voter receipts on 15 March 2016 at the Comelec's headquarters in Intramuros, Manila, Metro Manila.

Two bombs planted by the New People's Army (NPA) exploded near the residence of a police officer in Barangay Miaga, Uson town, Masbate on 15 March 2016. Another report stated the bombing could have targeted a Globe Telecom cell site.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2010-2016) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: The New People's Army (NPA) clashed with Members of Bravo Company of the Army's 4th Infantry Battalion in Sitio Mungos, Barangay Hagan area, Bongabong, Oriental Mindoro on 15 March 2016. Four members of the military's Civilian Armed Forces Geographical Unit (CAFGU) and another soldier were killed, four other CAFGU members were injured.
A bomb suspected to have been planted by the New People's Army exploded at the boundary of San Jacinto and San Fernando towns, Masbate on 15 March 2016.

A ranking leader of New People's Army (NPA) (Joan Casamorin alias Alvin) was arrested while another rebel was killed in a clash with the military and policemen in Barangay Buri, Matanao, Davao del Sur on 16 March 2016.

A former town mayor of Pangutaran town, Sulu who was running again for the same position under the United Nationalist Alliance (UNA) was gunned down by an unidentified assailant in Barangay Tetuan, Zamboanga City on 17 March 2016. The victim was expected to stand as a key witness to the 2010 suicide bombing at Zamboanga Airport.

Environmentalist groups, farmers and fisherfolk from Batangas and Cavite staged a protest on 17 March 2016 at the Department of Environment and Natural Resources (DENR) in Quezon City, Metro Manila calling for the closure of Calaca coal plants in Batangas province.

Over 2,000 Lumad, peasants and small-scale miners from Southern Mindanao staged a barricade on 18 March 2016 at the Eastern Mindanao Command (Eastmincom) headquarters in Davao City calling against the presence, harassment and attacks by the Army and paramilitary forces in local communities and schools.

18 March. A clash between the Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG) and the Army occurred in a remote location (also reported as Danag area) near Patikul town, Sulu on 18 March 2016 in. Seven ASG militants and one soldier were killed, and another sixteen soldiers and six ASG members were wounded, including a rebel commander.

Protesters demanding a stop to Lumad killings and the withdrawal of government soldiers from Lumad communities in Southern Mindanao staged a road block along the Pan-Philippine Highway near Barangay Panacan, Davao City on 18 March 2016.

Four soldiers and two civilians were wounded when an improvised explosive device (IED) detonated near the Mahawan-hawan Road in Labo area, Camarines Norte on 19 March 2016. The New People's Army (NPA) is suspected to have staged the attack.
The military clashed with New People's Army (NPA) near Gubat town area, Sorsogon on 19 March 2016. A soldier was wounded when an improvised explosive device detonated during the clash.
Ronel Bautista, the captain of Barangay Mangcasuy, Binalonan was gunned down by an unidentified assailant in Barangay Palaris, Asingan, Pangasinan on 20 March 2016.

actor2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2010-2016) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: A member of the Citizen Armed Forces Geographical Unit (CAFGU) was wounded when an unidentified assailant fired a grenade in Sitio Matias, Barangay Tumahubong, Sumisip town, Basilan on 20 March 2016.
An explosion occurred in Barangay Benembengan, Sumisip, Basilan. The perpetrator is unknown, although the region is known for frequent attacks led by the Abu Sayyaf.
Property destruction: Men hired by the aides of the Aquino-Cojuangco political elite clan destroyed over 20 hectares of crops on 21 March 2016 in Barangay Mapalacsiao, Hacienda Luisita, Tarlac.
The New People's Army (NPA) clashed with the military in Barangay Alanaw in Lupi town, Camarines Sur on 21 March 2016.
The New People's Army (NPA) clashed with the Army's 83rd Infantry Battalion at Barangay Antalon (Antolon area), Caramoan on 21 March 2016. An NPA member was killed during the clash.
Two New People's Army (NPA) members were killed during a clash with the Army's 9 ID's Division Reconnaissance Company at Barangay San Rafael, Lupi, Camarines Sur on 21 March 2016.

The New People's Army (NPA) clashed with the 62nd Infantry Battalion in Barangay Banquerohan in Cadiz City, Negros Occidental on 21 March 2016. Two NPA members were killed and three others were wounded.
Defusal: the military defused an improvised explosive device planted by the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) along the highway in Barangay Iganagampong, Datu Unsay, Maguindanao.

actor2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2010-2016) Philippine Marine Corps
notes: A clash between the Army's 5th Marine Battalion and the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) occurred in Barangay Andavit area, Datu Salibo, Maguindanao on 22 March 2016. Five Marines and nine BIFF members were wounded.
The Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) clashed with the Army in Sitio Balas, Barangay Tee, Datu Salibo, Maguindanao on 22 March 2016.
The Moro Islamic Liberation Front (MILF) killed two civilians as the militant group was retreating from a clash with the Abu Sayyaf in Barangay Guinanta area, Al-Barka, Basilan on 23 March 2016.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Purok 3, Barangay San Isidro, Trento, Agusan del Sur on 23 March 2016.

The Moro Islamic Liberation Front (MILF) (led by Pulung Pulalon) clashed with the Abu Sayyaf group (ASG) (led by Isnilon Hapilon) in Barangay Linuan area, Al-Barka, Basilan on 23 March 2016 (other reports stated Barangay Guinanta or the border between Linuan and Guinanta as the location). Three Abu Sayyaf members were killed. The casualties allegedly included Isnilon Hapilon's son, Haipa Hapilon.
A civilian was shot dead at Sugar Beach Resort in Barangay Pooc, Santa Fe, Bantayan Island on 25 March 2016. The killing is reportedly being linked to a land conflict.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: A drug suspect was killed in a vigilante-style attack by an unidentified assailant at Quezon City, Metro Manila on 25 Mar 16.

actor2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2010-2016) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: 25 March. The Abu Sayyaf (led by Eric Ajibon) clashed with the 4th Special Forces Battalion in Barangay Macalang area, Al-Barka, Basilan on 25 March 2016. Two Abu Sayyaf members were killed while seven soldiers of the Army's Special Forces were wounded.
Suspected Abu Sayyaf militants took 10 Indonesian sailors hostage after seizing their tugboat off Tapul, Sulu area on 26 March 2016.

source: United Press International; New York Times
notes: On 26 Mar 2016, 10 Indonesia crewmen were abducted by the Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG) while their tugboat was sailing from South Kalimantan province, Indonesia to Batangas province, Philippines. The tugboat has been recovered in the waters of Languyan, Tawi-Tawi, and the abducted crewmen were eventually freed by the ASG on 1 May 2016 in Jolo, Sulu, Philippines.
The mayor of Calauan town, Laguna was wounded while two civilians were killed in a gun attack by an unidentified assailant in Barangay Imok, Calauan on 27 March 2016.
A New People's Army (NPA) rebel was killed in a firefight with the military in Barangay area, Jabonga town, Agusan del Norte on 27 March 2016.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Barangay Peacekeeping Action Team
notes: Two members of Barangay Peace Action Team (BPAT) in Al-Barka, Basilan were seriously wounded when they stepped onto an improvised explosive device in Sitio Bohe Buug, Barangay Macalang, Al-Barka on 27 March 2016. The perpetrators are unknown yet it is suspected that the Abu Sayyaf planted the bomb.
A coordinator of a mayoral candidate was shot dead by unidentified gunmen in Barangay Casiaman, Bacnotan, La Union on 28 March 2016.
An improvised bomb exploded in Kulay Bato Elementary School in Lamitan City, Basilan in the evening of 28 March 2016. The perpetrator is unknown yet the police suspects the Abu Sayyaf group.

Four Marine soldiers were wounded when an improvised explosive device detonated along the Basilan Circumferential Road in Ungkaya Pukan town area, Basilan on 28 March 2016. The perpetrator is unknown.

On 29 Mar 2016, in Bukidnon, New People's Army (NPA) members attacked a command post leaving 2 soldiers dead and 1 other wounded. The victims are said to be members a team doing security operations in Upper Lubuna, Brgy. Casisang, Malaybalay City, Bukidnon.

A firefight erupted the police and assailants suspected of involvement in the drug- and firearms trade in Barangay Baliwasan Gusu, Zamboanga City on 30 March 2016. Three suspects were killed and 42 were arrested.
Farmers staged a barricade on 30 March 2016 at the National Food Authority in Kidapawan City, Cotabato against government neglect at a time of drought, demanding rice subsidies and relief.

assoc_actor_2: Drug Suspects (Philippines); Police Forces of the Philippines (2010-2016)
notes: 30 March. A policeman was shot dead by an unidentified assailant in Barangay Parang, Marikina City on 30 March 2016, supposedly due to his alleged involvement in the drug trade. Victim assumed to be off-duty and unarmed at time of attack.

source: AP; Manila Times; Australian Associated Press; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: Between 30 Mar-7 Apr 2016, around 6,000 farmers staged an ongoing protest in Kidapawan City, Cotabato to demand government relief worth 15,000 sacks of rice which was promised to them by the governor.

A clash between the New People's Army (NPA) and the military occurred in Sitio Kabisalan, Barangay Digdig, Carranglan, Nueva Ecija on 30 March 2016. An NPA member was killed and another rebel was captured.

Around 5,000 farmers barricaded parts of the Sultan Kudarat-Davao Highway in Kidapawan City area, Makilala, North Cotabato on 31 March 2016 in an effort to call on the government to address hunger resulting from droughts in the region. The New People's Army (NPA) is said to be partly responsible for the mass action as they have allegedly coerced farmers to demonstrate.

On 31 Mar 2016, a supporter of Sangguniang Bayan (SB) candidate was shot dead when their vehicle was gunned down allegedly by the Tineg Vice Mayor while the victims were en route to Lapat Balantay in Tineg, Abra.

source: Australian Associated Press; AP; Philippine Daily Inquirer; Manila Times
notes: Between 30 Mar-7 Apr 2016, around 6,000 farmers staged an ongoing protest in Kidapawan City, Cotabato to demand government relief worth 15,000 sacks of rice which was promised to them by the governor.

On 31 Mar 2016, in Brgy. Kisante in Makilala, North Cotabato, a 15-minute firefight occurred between New People's Army (NPA) members and the military after the NPAs attacked a detachment of the 72nd Infantry Battalion near a civilian-populated area. 1 child died while 2 others were wounded.
